sentence.Network_en: Don't act on caprice. Study your problem.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要任性行事, 研究一下自己的问题.

sentence.Network_en: He acted not from reason, but from caprice.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不是凭理智, 而是凭幻想来行动.

sentence.Network_en: Her refusal to go to the party is a mere caprice.
sentence.Network_cn: 她拒绝参加宴会完全是无理由的突发之举.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French, from Italian (see capriccio)

entry.def: A caprice is an unexpected action or decision which has no strong reason or purpose.

example.ex: I lived in terror of her sudden caprices and moods.
example.tran: 她的任性妄为和喜怒无常让我整天提心吊胆。

stems_affixes.word_buile: avar渴望+ice行为,状态→渴望状态→贪心
capr山羊+ice行为,状态→像山羊一样乱蹦→任性
coward懦弱的人,胆小的人+ice行为,状态→n.胆小,懦弱
crev裂开+ice行为,状态→n.缺口,裂缝
mal坏+ice行为,状态→n.恶意;蓄意犯罪
spli=split分裂+ice行为,状态→由分裂反推成衔接
